title: Through gloom of World Cup exit Scotland depart with heads held high after going toe-to-toe with Japan in a classic
text:
After all the protests and unseemly threats, this was Scotland’s opportunity to do their talking on the pitch and kill the Japanese fairytale. They managed the first part but not the second. Yet they depart this tournament in the group stages for just the second time with their heads held high after engaging in one of the great World Cup matches.

Many teams would simply have downed tools at 28-7 down against a Japanese side that had played 50 minutes of near total rugby. Yet Gregor Townsend’s managed to pick themselves up off the canvas and register two tries in five minutes. After rallying from a similar position at 31-0 to rescue a draw against England in the Six Nations, hitherto absent belief...
